main event: A bright glowing object was observed falling from east to west before disappearing into overcast clouds.
interesting points: The object was brighter than any star on a very clear night., It was visually tracked for three seconds., The observation was made from an aircraft at FL90., The object held a size of one fifth of an index finger tip at arm's length., The course of the object was westward, and it disappeared at an altitude of 5000 ft.
sighted object: a white steady glowing bright object
